author: hangleang.eth
content: has any CL clients already support `--max-blobs` flag or planning to add the support? https://ethpandaops.io/posts/fusaka-bandwidth-estimation/#3---max-blobs-flag

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Going forward ideally all CL teams should advertise all config values in their config/spec beacon api endpoint. 

To help determine which values are still missing we built in a spec checker into dora. 

If you see a little yellow triangle next to your node type, you know that we are still missing some values from your spec value.

I'd like to encourage everyone to include all fields.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Look for the little yellow triangle

author: jtraglia
content:
Random question. In teku I see that there are two subnet configs now:
* `--p2p-subscribe-all-subnets-enabled`
* `--p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled`
Does the first one only subscribe to all attestation/sync_committee subnets, without subscribing to all data column sidecar subnets? Is this how other clients have implemented this option? Does enabling the second one raise the node's custody setting to the maximum? Should there be an option to subscribe to all data column sidecar subnets without custodying them?

author: .paulharris
content:
Id love to but unfortunately most ppl at the moment seem to just be farming for airdrops, so thats soured the whole thing more than a little...
we've had a small handful this year, always on the lookout for geniune contributors I guess, and we do have a contributors channel for people to get help or whatever they need
